body_html:
@tatatodd tf.Print does have a gradient op, which is inserted in the gradient subgraph, but it does not log anything:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/logging_ops.py#L87

It is also true that ops that are not on a path from sink to source get pruned by the gradient computation:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/gradients.py#L368

Does that answer your question?

body:
@tatatodd tf.Print does have a gradient op, which is inserted in the gradient subgraph, but it does not log anything:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/logging_ops.py#L87

It is also true that ops that are not on a path from sink to source get pruned by the gradient computation:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/gradients.py#L368

Does that answer your question?
